content:
Sure, here's a second 7-day meal plan that's healthy, low in fat, and estimated to cost around $100 or less:

Day 1:

* Breakfast: Greek yogurt with fresh fruit and a sprinkle of granola.
* Lunch: Tuna salad with mixed greens and cherry tomatoes.
* Dinner: Grilled chicken with roasted vegetables (carrots, broccoli, and zucchini).

Day 2:

* Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with spinach and whole grain toast.
* Lunch: Lentil and vegetable soup with a side of whole grain crackers.
* Dinner: Baked salmon with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans.

Day 3:

* Breakfast: Smoothie made with mixed berries, almond milk, and banana.
* Lunch: Turkey and cheese wrap with mixed greens and cherry tomatoes.
* Dinner: Baked chicken breast with quinoa and sautéed spinach.

Day 4:

* Breakfast: Oatmeal with apple and cinnamon.
* Lunch: Hummus and veggie wrap with mixed greens, cucumber, and bell pepper.
* Dinner: Black bean chili with brown rice.

Day 5:

* Breakfast: Cottage cheese with fresh fruit and a sprinkle of chopped nuts.
* Lunch: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and a light vinaigrette dressing.
* Dinner: Shrimp stir-fry with mixed veggies and brown rice.

Day 6:

* Breakfast: Smoothie made with mixed berries, almond milk, and banana.
* Lunch: Chicken and veggie stir-fry with brown rice.
* Dinner: Baked sweet potato topped with black beans, salsa, and avocado.

Day 7:

* Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with spinach and whole grain toast.
* Lunch: Whole wheat pita stuffed with hummus, cucumber, tomato, and feta cheese.
* Dinner: Baked chicken breast with roasted vegetables (carrots, broccoli, and zucchini).

Again, don't forget to drink plenty of water throughout the day and engage in regular physical activity to complement your healthy eating habits. I hope you enjoy these meal ideas!
